üá™üá∫ This Women‚Äôs Day is for all Ukrainian women:
üá∫üá¶ fighting on the frontlines,
üá∫üá¶ saving lives,
üá∫üá¶ protecting their loved ones,
üá∫üá¶ leaving their lives behind, and
üá∫üá¶ standing up for freedom.

We stand with the women of Ukraine. We stand with the people of Ukraine.

This video was made using stories of Ukrainian heroes published on üëâhttps://war.ukraine.ua/

Thanks to the generous support of our audiences, A Concert for Ukraine on Monday, March 14, is sold out. Check our website in the coming days for any ticket returns and tune in to the live broadcast of the concert on National Public Radio, the European Broadcasting Union, Met Opera Radio on @siriusxm channel 355, and metopera.org. We encourage continued donations to relief efforts, which can be made through the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine website.

Donate at war.ukraine.ua/support-ukraine/

Photo by Jonathan Tichler / Met Opera

How you can help.

In preparation for tomorrow‚Äôs benefit concert to support Ukraine, Met Music Director @nezetseguin recently joined the @metorchestra and an array of star soloists in the rehearsal room. Tune in tomorrow, March 14, at 6PM ET for a live broadcast of the concert on National Public Radio, the European Broadcasting Union, Metropolitan Opera Radio on @siriusxm channel 355, and metopera.org. For a full list of participating stations, visit metopera.org/ConcertforUkraine.

Even though the performance is sold out, we encourage continued donations to relief efforts, which can be made through the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine website, war.ukraine.ua/support-ukraine/.

Photo by Jonathan Tichler / Met Opera

@metopera In these excerpts from A Concert for Ukraine, tonight‚Äôs benefit performance to support those suffering from the ongoing war in Ukraine, Music Director @nezetseguin conducts the extraordinary @metorchestra and @metoperachorus and a roster of star soloists, including Ukrainian bass-baritone Vladyslav Buialskyi @umbertokor who gave a moving performance of the Ukrainian national anthem, and soprano @lisedavidsen‚Äôs stunning rendition of Strauss‚Äôs Four Last Songs. The concert ended with a stirring performance of the finale from Beethoven‚Äôs Symphony No. 9 with @elzasoprano @jbartonmezzo @piotrbeczala @speedogreen 
 
The response to the live broadcast was overwhelming, so we‚Äôre pleased to announce that the performance will be available to stream on demand, starting at 12PM ET tomorrow, March 15, for seven days at metopera.org.
 
We also encourage continued donations to relief efforts, which can be made through the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine website, war.ukraine.ua/support-ukraine/.

Videography by Pete Scalzitti / Met Opera

In these excerpts from A Concert for Ukraine, tonight‚Äôs benefit performance to support those suffering from the ongoing war in Ukraine, Music Director @nezetseguin conducts the extraordinary @metorchestra and @metoperachorus and a roster of star soloists, including Ukrainian bass-baritone Vladyslav Buialskyi, who gave a moving performance of the Ukrainian national anthem, and soprano @lisedavidsen‚Äôs stunning rendition of Strauss‚Äôs Four Last Songs. The concert ended with a stirring performance of the finale from Beethoven‚Äôs Symphony No. 9.
 
The response to the live broadcast was overwhelming, so we‚Äôre pleased to announce that the performance will be available to stream on demand, starting at 12PM ET tomorrow, March 15, for seven days at metopera.org.
 
We also encourage continued donations to relief efforts, which can be made through the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine website, war.ukraine.ua/support-ukraine/.

Videography by Pete Scalzitti / Met Opera

Tonight, the fa√ßade of the opera house was lit with the colors of the Ukrainian flag during our benefit performance to support Ukraine and its citizens. Met Music Director @nezetseguin led the @metorchestra and @metoperachorus and a roster of star soloists. The response to the live broadcast was overwhelming, and we're pleased to announce that the broadcast will be available to stream on demand, starting at 12PM ET tomorrow, March 15, for seven days at metopera.org. 

We encourage continued donations to relief efforts, which can be made through the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine website. 

Donate: war.ukraine.ua/support-ukraine/

Photo by Jonathan Tichler / Met Opera

When you have the chance to go to The Met for a special performance- the energy and connection you feel to the musicians, artists and other patrons is indescribable.  There is a camaraderie through music that is unlike anything else.  It refocuses you on the humanity of all people.  I‚Äôm sure last night was no different.  #standwithukraine #metopera 
.
Repost from @metopera

In these excerpts from A Concert for Ukraine, tonight‚Äôs benefit performance to support those suffering from the ongoing war in Ukraine, Music Director @nezetseguin conducts the extraordinary @metorchestra and @metoperachorus and a roster of star soloists, including Ukrainian bass-baritone Vladyslav Buialskyi, who gave a moving performance of the Ukrainian national anthem, and soprano @lisedavidsen‚Äôs stunning rendition of Strauss‚Äôs Four Last Songs. The concert ended with a stirring performance of the finale from Beethoven‚Äôs Symphony No. 9.
 
The response to the live broadcast was overwhelming, so we‚Äôre pleased to announce that the performance will be available to stream on demand, starting at 12PM ET tomorrow, March 15, for seven days at metopera.org.
 
We also encourage continued donations to relief efforts, which can be made through the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine website, war.ukraine.ua/support-ukraine/.

Videography by Pete Scalzitti / Met Opera

We call on everyone in the world to help
our Ukraine in this difficult time.

The official sources to support our country:
üåê https://war.ukraine.ua/support-ukraine/

Hello, my dear Ukraine!
I have as much pain now as you do.
But don‚Äôt be afraid, we‚Äôre close.
Here are our hearts, where you are in, because it‚Äôs a safe place!
Hold on dear, we are always with you.
You see, there are millions of us! Worldwide.
Though we are all so different. Absolutely different.
But we are as one! We will not give you to anyone!
Neither putin nor russia‚Ä¶
Your faithful, wounded Kyiv will become stronger!
Kharkiv will surprise you more than once!
The whole world will enchant you with your beauty, 
because there is no other country like you, my Ukraine. You are the only one!

This past Monday night, the Met offered artistic solace and financial support to those suffering as a result of the ongoing war in Ukraine with our benefit performance, A Concert for Ukraine. The concert ended with the @metorchestra and @metoperachorus‚Äôs stirring rendition of the ‚ÄúOde to Joy‚Äù from Beethoven‚Äôs Symphony No. 9, led by Music Director @nezetseguin.

The response to the live broadcast was overwhelming, so we‚Äôre pleased to offer the full performance, available for streaming on demand, now through March 21 at metopera.org.

We also encourage continued donations to relief efforts, which can be made through the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine website.

Donate: war.ukraine.ua/support-ukraine/

Videography by Pete Scalzitti / Met Opera

On Monday evening, the Met presented A Concert for Ukraine, a benefit performance to support those suffering as a result of the ongoing war in Ukraine. In these selections from the concert, Music Director @nezetseguin conducts the @metorchestra, @metoperachorus and an array of star soloists in program that included the Ukrainian national anthem and music by Barber, Strauss, Verdi, and Beethoven.

If you weren‚Äôt able to join us, you can listen to a recording of the live radio broadcast on demand now through March 21 at metopera.org.
We also encourage continued donations to relief efforts, which can be made through the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine website.

Donate today at war.ukraine.ua/support-ukraine/.

Videography by Pete Scalzitti / Met Opera

Last Monday night, Ukrainian bass-baritone Vladyslav Buialskyi gave a moving performance of the Ukrainian national anthem‚Äîjoined by the incomparable @metorchestra and @metoperachorus, led by Music Director @nezetseguin‚Äîas part of A Concert for Ukraine, our benefit performance to support those suffering as a result of the ongoing war in Ukraine.
 
If you weren‚Äôt able to join us, you can listen to a recording of the live radio broadcast on demand, now through April 1, at metopera.org.
 
We also encourage donations to relief efforts, which can be made through the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine website.
 
Donate today at war.ukraine.ua/support-ukraine/
 
Videography by Pete Scalzitti / Met Opera

#KejahatanPerangrusia 
Tindak kekejaman tentara rusia terlampau jahat, bahkan saat perang sekali pun. Sekarang, setiap kejahatan perang Rusia di Ukraina didokumentasikan di situs resmi Ukraina ‚Äî https://war.ukraine.ua/russia-war-crimes/
Di situs tersebut, Anda dapat menyaksikan sebagian kecil dari bagaimana rakyat Ukraina harus bertahan hidup selama lebih dari enam minggu. Bagaimana rasanya mendengar suara sirene serangan udara, pesawat tempur, dan serangan rudal. Bagaimana rasanya membaca kesaksian-kesaksian yang mengerikan dari mereka yang berhasil selamat.
Seluruh dunia harus tau kebenarannya. Anda harus tau kebenarannya. Sebarkan informasi ini agar rusia diadili atas semua yang telah mereka lakukan.

#rusiaInvasiUkraina
#HentikanAgresirusia #russiaInvadedUkraine #StoprussianAgression

Situs ini menyajikan informasi terkait kejahatan, jumlah korban, pernyataan penyintas, serta memberikan pengalaman seperti berada di tengah situasi perang, dengan efek rekaman audio saat kita mengakses situs. Kunjungi situs kami untuk terus mengawal keadilan dan kemanusiaan untuk Ukraina.

Donations from the Met Orchestra, the Met‚Äôs music staff, and a significant contribution from Music Director @nezetseguin were raised with the hope that it demonstrates our solidarity with all musicians in Ukraine and inspires other musical institutions around the world to join this vital fundraising initiative.

We also encourage continued donations to relief efforts, which can be made through the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine website, war.ukraine.ua/support-ukraine/.
